contentrichtext.text: '''Tol Air''' (Tol Air Services Inc.) was a charter and cargo [[airline]] based at [[Luis Muñoz Marín International Airport]] in [[San Juan, Puerto Rico]]. It was established in 1981 and started operations on 16 May 1983. It operated daily cargo charter flights from Puerto Rico to 10 destinations in the [[Caribbean]]. In April 2006, Tol Air was purchased by [[Four Star Air Cargo]]. [[Image:TolAirPR.jpg|right|150px]] ==Code data== *[[International Air Transport Association|IATA]] Code: '''TI''' *[[International Civil Aviation Organisation|ICAO]] Code: '''TOL''' *Callsign: Tol Air ==Fleet== The Tol Air fleet consisted of the following aircraft (at January 2005):{{fact|date=February 2012}} *4 [[Beechcraft Model 18|Beech E18S]] *3 [[Convair 240]] *6 [[Douglas DC-3|Douglas DC-3C]] More recently it consists of:{{fact|date=February 2012}} *1 - [[Convair 240|Convair CV-440]] *5 - [[Beechcraft King Air]] *3 - [[Cessna 402]] *5 - [[Douglas DC-3]] ==Accidents and incidents== *On 30 December 2003, [[Douglas DC-3|Douglas DC-3C]] N781T was substantially damaged when the starboard undercarriage collapsed on landing at [[Cyril E. King Airport]], [[Charlotte Amalie, United States Virgin Islands|Charlotte Amalie]] after a flight that originated at [[San Juan, Puerto Rico]].<ref name=ASN301203>{{cite web|url=http://aviation-safety.net/database/record.php?id=20031230-0 |title=N781T Accident description |publisher=Aviation Safety Network |accessdate=21 June 2001}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.tolair.com/ Tol Air] *[http://www.fourstaraircargo.com/ Four Star Air Cargo] [[Category:Cargo airlines]] [[Category:Defunct airlines of Puerto Rico]] [[Category:Airlines established in 1981]] [[Category:Airlines disestablished in 2006]] [[Category:Airlines of Puerto Rico]]
